metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43538 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
By misusing a race in our notification code, an attacker could haveforcefully hidden the notification for pages that had received full screenand pointer lock access, which could have been used for spoofing attacks.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, andFirefox < 95.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required
